intro: Dyssodia pentachaeta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dyssodia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Dyssodia pentachaeta is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in its native habitat.
